welcome_message: Welcome to the official website of the Ethiopian Chamber of Commerce and Sectoral Associations (ECCSA), a platform dedicated to fostering economic growth, trade, and investment in Ethiopia.
history: For decades, ECCSA has played a pivotal role in representing and advocating for the Ethiopian business community. Our chamber's historical journey reflects a commitment to strengthening the private sector, facilitating business networking, and influencing policies that create a conducive environment for economic development.
description1: Expand business reach through local and international trade linkages.
description2: Connect with industry leaders, potential partners, and new business opportunities.
description3: Enhance business skills through mentorship, workshops, and expert-led training.
description4: Showcase products and services at local and international trade events.

testimonials.subtitle:
Words By our
Amazing Clients
testimonials.intro: See how our services is helping businesses reach new heights
testimonials.quote: The training and capacity building programs offered by ECCSA have greatly enhanced my business management skills and market competitiveness.
testimonials.author: Fitsum Getachew

paragraph3: Founded during the post-World War II era, ECCSA emerged as a platform to foster economic recovery and modernization under Emperor Haile Selassie I, who recognized the critical role of a thriving private sector in national development.
paragraph4: Over the decades, ECCSA's journey has mirrored Ethiopia’s shifting economic frameworks—from the nationalization and suppression of private enterprise during the socialist Derg regime to the re-emergence of market-oriented policies in the early 1990s.
paragraph5: The Chamber was restructured in 2003 under Proclamation No. 341/2003, incorporating sectoral associations to broaden its representation and influence across diverse industries. Today, ECCSA stands as a dynamic institution, playing a critical role in shaping Ethiopia’s economic policies, advocating for private sector interests, and driving initiatives that promote trade and investment.
paragraph6: Its contributions have been instrumental in fostering public-private dialogue, addressing regulatory challenges, and enhancing Ethiopia’s competitiveness on the global stage. In the face of rapid globalization, technological disruption, and evolving economic paradigms, ECCSA must strategically position itself to remain relevant, resilient, and impactful.
visionStatement: To see private sector led economy and inclusive growth within two strategic periods.
missionStatement: To represent, support, and advocate for Ethiopia's private sector, promoting trade, investment, and innovation to drive inclusive economic growth and national prosperity.
promoteDescription: Stand out in the directory and reach 10,000+ local users.
